title: Appendices
subtitle: Templates, resources, and reference materials
content:

  • NAICS Industry Codes
  • ISO Currency Codes (ISO 4217)
  • Country Codes (ISO 3166)

  • Spend Analysis Best Practices

  • Power BI Development Standards
  • Category Management Guide

Glossary of Terms

AP (Accounts Payable)
Department responsible for paying invoices and managing vendor relationships
Categorization
Process of classifying spend into hierarchical categories for analysis
DAX (Data Analysis Expressions)
Formula language used in Power BI for calculations
ERP (Enterprise Resource Planning)
Integrated software system managing business processes
GL (General Ledger)
Complete record of financial transactions
Maverick Spend
Purchases made outside of negotiated contracts or preferred vendors
PO (Purchase Order)
Commercial document issued by buyer to seller
Pareto Analysis
80/20 rule - 80% of spend typically with 20% of vendors
Spend Cube
Multi-dimensional analysis of spend by vendor, category, and time
Tail Spend
Low-value, high-transaction volume purchases
Taxonomy
Hierarchical classification system for organizing spend

Quick Reference Cards

Data Quality Thresholds

  • Completeness: >95%
  • Accuracy: >98%
  • Duplicates: <1%
  • Standardization: 100%

Timeline Milestones

  • Day 1-3: Data Collection
  • Day 4-5: Quality Assessment
  • Day 6-9: Cleansing
  • Day 10-16: Categorization
  • Day 17-22: Dashboard Build

Key Contacts

  • Data Team: data@versatex.com
  • IT Support: itsupport@versatex.com
  • PMO: pmo@versatex.com
  • Help Desk: x1234

Frequently Asked Questions

Q: What if source data is incomplete?

A: Request missing data from source system owners. If unavailable, document gaps and proceed with available data, clearly noting limitations in final deliverables.

Q: How often should the dashboard be refreshed?

A: Daily refresh is recommended for operational use. Weekly refresh is minimum for strategic reporting. Monthly data loads for historical analysis.

Q: What's the minimum data history required?

A: 12 months minimum, 24 months preferred. This enables year-over-year comparisons and seasonal trend identification.

Q: Can we integrate real-time data?

A: Yes, using DirectQuery mode in Power BI. However, this impacts performance. Recommended for small datasets or specific KPIs only.

Q: How do we handle multiple currencies?

A: Convert all amounts to single base currency (typically USD) using monthly average exchange rates. Store original currency for reference.
